contentrichtext.text: {{ infobox software license | name = Netscape Public License | author = [[Netscape]] | version = 1.1 | copyright = Netscape | date = ? | OSI approved = No | Debian approved = ? | Free Software = Yes | GPL compatible = No<ref>{{cite web |title=Netscape Public License (NPL) |work=Various Licenses and Comments about Them |publisher=Free Software Foundation |url=http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html#NPL |accessdate=May 23, 2013 }}</ref> | copyleft = Limited | linking = Yes }} The '''Netscape Public License''' (NPL) is a [[free software license]], the license under which [[Netscape Communications Corporation]] originally released [[Mozilla]]. Its most notable feature is that it gives the original developer of Mozilla ([[Netscape Communications Corporation|Netscape]], now a subsidiary of [[AOL]]), the right to distribute modifications made by other contributors under whatever terms it desires, including [[proprietary software|proprietary]] terms, without granting similar rights to these other contributors in respect to contributions made by the original developer. This allowed the release of the [[Netscape (web browser)|Netscape]] 6 and later versions as proprietary software. This asymmetry with respect to rights has led to criticism of the license by many members of the [[open source]] and [[free software]] movements: the [[Free Software Foundation]] [http://www.fsf.org/licensing/licenses/ acknowledged it] as a free-software license but one to be avoided, and the [[Open Source Initiative]] either [http://opensource.org/licenses/alphabetical rejected it entirely or was not asked to review it]. The FSF adds that it's not possible to combine software obtained under the license with software obtained under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]]. The [[Mozilla Public License]] version 1.1 is similar (and has limited "file-level copyleft"), but lacks the asymmetry in rights. Time Warner, exercising its rights under the Netscape Public License, and at the request of the Mozilla Foundation, [http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/relicensing-faq.html relicensed] all code in Mozilla that was under the Netscape Public License (including code by other contributors) to an MPL 1.1/GPL 2.0/[[GNU Lesser General Public License|LGPL]] 2.1 [[tri-license]], thus removing the GPL-incompatibility. ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.mozilla.org/MPL/NPL-1.0.html Netscape Public License version 1.0] {{Netscape}} [[Category:Mozilla]] [[Category:Netscape]] [[Category:Free and open-source software licenses]]
